org.js4ms.amt.proxy

Class SourceFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.js4ms.amt.proxy.SourceFilter

  • public final class SourceFilter
extends Object
    Describes the current reception state for a single multicast group address.
    Author:
    Greg Bumgardner (gbumgard)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SourceFilter.Mode
      An enumeration of filter modes.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static byte MODE_IS_EXCLUDE
      MODE_IS_EXCLUDE - indicates that the interface has a filter mode of EXCLUDE for the specified multicast address.
      static byte MODE_IS_INCLUDE
      MODE_IS_INCLUDE - indicates that the interface has a filter mode of INCLUDE for the specified multicast address.

      Constructs a filter with a mode of INCLUDE and an empty source list.

    • Field Detail

      • MODE_IS_INCLUDE

        public static final byte MODE_IS_INCLUDE
        MODE_IS_INCLUDE - indicates that the interface has a filter mode of INCLUDE for the specified multicast address. The Source Address [i] fields in this Group Record contain the interface's source list for the specified multicast address, if it is non-empty.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MODE_IS_EXCLUDE

        public static final byte MODE_IS_EXCLUDE
        MODE_IS_EXCLUDE - indicates that the interface has a filter mode of EXCLUDE for the specified multicast address. The Source Address [i] fields in this Group Record contain the interface's source list for the specified multicast address, if it is non-empty.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • apply

        public void apply(SourceFilter filter)
        Updates the source filter from another source filter.
      • If this filter is in the INCLUDE mode and the other filter is in the EXCLUDE mode, this filter is changed to match the other filter.
      • If this filter is in the INCLUDE mode and the other filter is in the INCLUDE mode, the source list of the other filter is merged
      • If this filter is in the EXCLUDE mode and the other filter is in the INCLUDE mode, this filter is changed to match the other filter.
      • If this filter is in the EXCLUDE mode and the other filter is in the EXCLUDE mode, the source list of the other filter is merged with this filter's source list.
Parameters:
sourceAddress -

  • exclude

    public void exclude(InetAddress sourceAddress)
    Sets filter to EXCLUDE mode and adds the address to the source set. If the filter was in INCLUDE mode, the source list is cleared first.
    Parameters:
    sourceAddress -

  • include

    public void include(InetAddress sourceAddress)
    Sets filter to INCLUDE mode and adds the address to the source set. If the filter was in EXCLUDE mode, the source list is cleared first.
    Parameters:
    sourceAddress -

  • join

    public void join()
          throws IOException
    Clears source list and sets mode to EXCLUDE so no sources are filtered. Typically called when joining an any-source multicast (ASM) group.
    Throws:
    IOException - If an attempt is made to join a group already joined.

  • leave

    public void leave()
           throws IOException
    Clears source list and sets mode to INCLUDE so all sources are filtered. Typically called when leaving an ASM or SSM group.
    Throws:
    IOException - If an attempt is made to leave a group that has not been joined.

  • join

    public void join(InetAddress sourceAddress)
          throws IOException
    Adds the specified source address to the source list to indicate an SSM join for the source and source filter group.
    Parameters:
    sourceAddress - - The source address component of an (S,G) pair to be added to this filter.
    Throws:
    IOException - If the specified source address is already contained in the filter source list.

  • leave

    public void leave(InetAddress sourceAddress)
           throws IOException
    Removes the specified source address from the source list to indicate an SSM leave for the source and source filter group.
    Parameters:
    sourceAddress - - The source address component of an (S,G) pair to be removed from this filter.
    Throws:
    IOException - If the specified source address is not contained in the filter source list.
